topic: How to combine antigravity with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine antigravity with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Combining Antigravity and Typing in Python 3.12+ Production Code
response_parsed.summary: This guide explores the integration of antigravity concepts with the Python 3.12+ typing system to write efficient, safe, and space-defying production code.
key_points: Leveraging Python's static type checking to enhance code readability and catch errors at compile time
Utilizing antigravity principles to reduce the weight of your Python programs for faster execution
Implementing custom type hints to precisely define function arguments, return types, and variables
Using built-in type annotations like Union, List, Dict, Tuple, and Callable to enhance type safety

code_examples.code:
def add(a: float | int, b: float | int) -> float | int:
    return a + b

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to use the latest typing features
Ensure you install or upgrade your Python interpreter if needed
caveats: Remember, antigravity integration may not be officially supported in standard Python distributions
Antigravity-infused code can lead to unpredictable results when executed on planets with significant gravitational forces
